E01.name: Statement
E01.description: The structured supporting data that can be used to assess criterion in the context of a given interpretation guideline.
E01.notes: TODO: Re-write in reference to Evidence Lines. Consider merging with Entity and explaining the equivalence between Data in SEPIO and Entity in W3C-Prov.

E02.name: MolecularConsequence
E02.description: Classification of an Allele based on its effect on a product

E03.name: ConditionMechanism
E03.description: Qualitative information about the types of alleles that cause a condition

E04.name: Criterion
E04.description: A single rule for evaluating data in an interpretation.

E05.name: CanonicalAllele
E05.description: Reference-independent allele that groups multiple ContextualAlleles

E09.name: CriterionAssessment
E09.description: Intermediate interpretation of a line of evidence

E11.name: Contribution
E11.description:
(TODO:review this def)
Conceptual class to record provenance related to the creation of an item (e.g., who and when)

E12.name: Agent
E12.description: A person, group of people, algorithm, or some other actor that could perform an activity.

E13.name: Example
E13.description: An example selected to demonstrate a particular facet of the data model
E13.notes: Is this really a "Type" in the model, or are these examples just listed in the spreadsheet for documentation purposes?

E14.name: MendelianCondition
E14.description: A condition with a specific mode of inheritance
E14.notes: What specifically distinguishes a medellian condition? It's possible this could be stated as a set of axioms.

E17.name: IndividualCondition
E17.description: Whether or not an Individual has a Condition

E18.name: FamilyHistory
E18.description: Whether or not a Condition occurs in a given Family

E19.name: DeNovoAllele
E19.description: Whether or not a particular Allele is DeNovo in an Individual

E20.name: AlleleFunctionalImpact
E20.description: Data about the function of a gene product

E21.name: CaseControl
E21.description: Allele frequencies as a function of case-control status

E22.name: SequenceLocation
E22.description: Location, position or interval on a given sequence

E23.name: AlleleFrequency
E23.description: The frequency of an allele in a population or a defined group of individuals

E24.name: RegionType
E24.description: Whether or not a sequence region is of a certain type or types.

E25.name: RegionAlleles
E25.description: Whether or not sequence region contains a given set of alleles.

E28.name: IndividualAllele
E28.description: Whether or not an Individual has an allele

E32.name: AssertionMethod
E32.description: The set of rules describing how to create an interpretation from a set of Data.

E33.name: ScoringAlgorithm
E33.description: The rules for combining CriterionAssessments into an Interpretation

E35.name: VariantInterpretation
E35.description: Evidence-based conclusion about the pathogenicity of a sequence variant

E40.name: CodeableConcept
E40.description: (FHIR) defines the structure needed to support the use cases that allow for the flexibility of representing a concept by either a text name or a set of equivalent Codings or both.

E41.name: CodeSystem
E41.description: (FHIR) defines a set of codes with meanings (also known as enumeration, terminology, classification, and/or ontology)

E42.name: Coding
E42.description: (FHIR) Concepts that are in the code system. The concept definitions are inherently hierarchical, but the definitions must be consulted to determine what the meaning of the hierarchical relationships are.

E43.name: BenignMissenseVariationRate
E43.description: The amount of benign missense variation in a particular region

E44.name: Family
E44.description: A group of individuals related in a known manner.

E45.name: FamilySegregation
E45.description: Cosegregation of an allele and a condition in a single family

E46.name: AggregateSegregation
E46.description: Cosegregation of an allele and a condition aggregated across families

E47.name: InSilicoPrediction
E47.description: Computationally predicted functional impact of an allele

E48.name: ConditionEtiology
E48.iri-label:
condition gene specificity?

genetic etiology?

locus heterogeneity?
E48.description: Specificity of the condition to a gene.

E49.name: ConditionPrevelance
E49.description: Frequency of a condition in a population

E50.name: ConditionPenetrance
E50.description: Qualitative characterization of a condition's penetrance

E51.name: Conservation
E51.description: Characterizes whether the allele is fixed across species

E54.name: ValueSet
E54.description: (FHIR) A value set specifies a set of codes drawn from one or more code systems.

E55.name: ValueSetCoding
E55.description: This maps to the use of codes in relationship to ValueSets in HL7 FHIR.  For details on understanding how Codes and ValueSets are defined see HL7 FHIR spec 4.1 Using Codes and its subsections (https://www.hl7.org/fhir/terminologies.html) .
E55.notes: Should this be its own type, or is it just a mapping table?

E56.name: EvidenceLine
E56.description: A reification of the underlying supporting data which may be one or more data points or assertions. Typically grouped in a specific manner for use in an owning assertion activity (either Variant Interpretation or CriterionAssessment. All evidence may optionally be given a strength by an agent.
